title: [$250] Remove Modal-Triggered Rerenders from Hoverable

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from Slack [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764326614475289) ### Background Hoverable is a cross-app component responsible for changing an element’s background on pointer hover (web-only feature, native platforms don't use it). It is used broadly across the product, including in lists, banners, and video controls. Many features also rely on modals (such as search, confirmations, and right-hand panels) whose visibility state is stored in Onyx. Every time a modal opens or closes, the associated Onyx modal key updates. Hoverable currently depends on the modal key. ### Problem When a modal’s visibility state changes in Onyx, every Hoverable instance rerenders unnecessarily. ### Solution Instead of subscribing Hoverable to the modal’s Onyx key, we pass an explicit isFocused prop to indicate whether the screen containing the Hoverable is currently active ([draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76216)) This replaces the original intent of the modal dependency (clearing hover state on the search page when [renaming a saved search](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/66845)) while eliminating global rerenders triggered by unrelated modal activity. Implementation steps: 1. Remove dependency on the modal Onyx key from Hoverable. 2. Add an isFocused prop to Hoverable. 3. In lists that require clearing the hover state (MenuItemList), set isFocused based on navigation focus. This ensures Hoverable only rerenders when its own screen context changes, not when any modal in the app updates. ### Impact This change affects the entire app, given the broad use of Hoverable. Localised testing demonstrates significant performance gains: Opening the search modal on a report screen with ~80 report actions (larger lists amplify the effect): - Before: - Total: 776ms - Hoverable: 285ms - After: - Total: 623ms (20% faster) - Hoverable: 16ms (95% reduction)
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~021995466431388798169
  • Upwork Job ID: 1995466431388798169
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-12-01
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @war-in

title: Eliminating Redundant Onyx Subscriptions

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from a proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764249059104699)

### Background
The ReportActionItemSingle component is responsible for rendering individual rows within a chat report, often appearing in lists containing hundreds of items. To properly display avatars for IOU previews (money requests), the system must determine a "sender ID" using complex logic that aggregates data from Onyx collections. Currently, the useReportPreviewSenderID hook establishes these subscriptions and performs these calculations for every single item in the list, and this hook is effectively invoked in parallel with useReportActionAvatars, which manages similar avatar logic.

### Problem
When a user scrolls through a report containing many actions, if the system renders ReportActionItemSingle components, then it triggers duplicate heavy calculations and initializes unnecessary Onyx subscriptions for data that is often irrelevant (specifically for optimistic actions or duplicate calls), resulting in measurable frame drops and excessive memory consumption.

### Solution
1. Remove duplicate useReportPreviewSenderID call from ReportActionItemSingle.
2. Inside useReportActionAvatars return reportPreviewSenderID and use it in ReportActionItemSingle
3. Pass undefined to Onyx keys when action is optimistic to prevent unnecessary subscriptions.
4. Add early returns in useReportPreviewSenderID after checking amount signs and attendee count.

[Draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76010)
Performance scripting time:
- chat with a lot items: scripting time reduced from 2,463ms to 1900ms
- chat with just 3 items, little scroll: scripting time almost the same 249ms to 237ms
- medium size chat: scripting time reduced from 790ms to 680ms

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @akinwale</details>

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @BartekObudzinski</details>

Start invite member flow 2. On confirmation page, click Role 3. Reload the page 4. Note that we stays at the same page 5. Invite the member 6. Select the invited member 7. Click Role 8. Reload the page Bug 2: 1. Invite the member 2. Select invited member 3. Select Profile 4. Click overlay 5. Note that the RHP is closed 6. Select invited member again 7. Select role 8. Click overlay ## Expected Result: Bug 1: Role page should stay opened after reloading, same as invite flow Bug 2: RHP should be closed ## Actual Result: Bug 1: Role page is closed Bug 2: Role page is closed, RHP remains opened. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.66-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75718 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdnsoijsonjsdisdoj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Bug 1: 1.Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two empty reports. 4. On the first empty report preview, click Add expense > Create expense. 5. Complete the flow to create an expense in the first report. Bug 2: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two reports. 4. Rename the reports above to A and B respectively. 5. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual. 6. Enter amount > Next. 7. On confirm page, enter merchant. 8. On confirm page, click Report field. 9. Select Report A. 10. Click Create expense. 11. Go back to workspace chat. ## Expected Result: Bug 1: The new expense will be created in the first report. Bug 2: The new expense will be created in Report A. ## Actual Result: Bug 1: The new expense is created in the second report when it is created from the first report. Bug 2: The new expense is created in Report B, but it opens Report A after creating the expense. This issue also happens when Step 6 is performed in the workspace chat, or when submitting expense in self DM to workspace chat with the same Step 8 to 11. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/07377b2c-f248-4c79-8a31-01037aef8d66 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9da831a1-7146-4ebe-8b46-15feebb04261 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
